instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Failed GPU Prox, Die, L/R Fin
threads.message:
Received <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> as "running slow, fans high". 
<CHIP>U8900</CHIP> previously 'repaired' by Apple. I replaced with leaded still. All else looks great, no liquid, only some thermal paste residue. 
Testing showed 8 related failed sensors - GPU proximity, GPU Die, Left/Right Fin stack. visually, <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> area looked good. Tested against a good board - solid 3.3v in, resistors are good but pins 2,3,4,5 are bouncing around from .3v-.9v. Replaced <CAPACITOR>C5551</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C5552</CAPACITOR> with no change. Swapped <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> (from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) and the issue appeared to be gone, pins 2-5 were all at consistent voltages. 
Installed and tested, fans still high and sensors failed again. PRAM reset x3 and SMC reset. Ran fine and passed the tests. 
Let sit overnight without power and this morning the issue is back. Resets will not solve. <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> still testing good. 
Pics included. (MUX switching failure due to testing without display).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Failed GPU Prox, Die, L/R Fin
threads.message:
Voltages back to bouncing around on pins 2,3,4,5. Replaced <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> again, this time from a 3332. No change immediately, but after looking over the board and verifying traces between <TRANSISTOR>Q5501</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q5503</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> the voltages on <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> have leveled out and the board runs fine. 
I don't think i'm solving the issue here. Not sure how these symptoms can come and go unless theres some trace/connection somewhere thats hit or miss.. Will run through the cleaner and see what happens. 

Only found one other similar topic: [url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/21549-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-th1h-sensor-error[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Failed GPU Prox, Die, L/R Fin
threads.message: I would say replace <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> if possible.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Failed GPU Prox, Die, L/R Fin
threads.message:
Be sure all traces from <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> to its sensors are OK.
Check SCL/SDA lines too.
Also chek/change <RESISTOR>R5551</RESISTOR>/52.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Failed GPU Prox, Die, L/R Fin
threads.message:
Replaced <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> - Fans high and running slow. Reset SMC - runs normal and sensors passed on the first loop of testing then failed on the second. 
Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5501</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q5503</TRANSISTOR> - Runs normal then same as above. First L/R fin stack failed then GPU Die followed. 

SDA around <CHIP>U5550</CHIP> and to test point by SMC is all good, same with SCL and test point on opposite side. 
<CHIP>U5550</CHIP> to sensors match good board. 

Bad SMC as sometimes a reset will help for a bit? Otherwise, I'm thinking broken ball/trace somewhere thats affected by board movement.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Failed GPU Prox, Die, L/R Fin
threads.message: Try other SMC, or reball the original.
